snippet: The administration has evolved from secrecy to at least talking about openness since the disclosure of the N.S.A.’s sweeping surveillance program.
abstract: Editorial praises Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court for ordering the government to review for possible release the court's opinions about the National Security Agency's phone-records program; calls for the release of the court's opinions.
lead_paragraph: The administration has evolved from secrecy to at least talking about openness since the disclosure of the N.S.A.’s sweeping surveillance program.

headline.main: Steps Toward a Less Secret Court
headline.print_headline: Steps Toward a Less Secret Court
